name: reinflate
content:
reinflate verb [I or T]
(FILL WITH AIR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to increase in size by being filled with air again; to make something increase in size in this way: The balloon slowly reinflated. I reinflated the tyre with a foot pump. Related word
reinflation
More examplesFewer examplesThe doctors inserted a tube to reinflate the lung.The pockets of air in the dough didn't re-inflate.

reinflate verb [I or T]
(ECONOMY)
finance & economics
  specialized to have or cause a general increase in prices and economic activity after a period when prices have been falling and there has been little economic activity: The government made a concerted attempt to reinflate the economy. The country's economy simply refuses to reinflate. New buyers now have access to enough credit to re-inflate housing prices. Related word
reinflation
More examplesFewer examplesThey believe that their spending plans can re-inflate the economy.
